0:
--------------------
Text: European windstorm is a name given to the strongest extratropical cyclones which occur across the continent of Europe.
Triplets:<European windstorm
1:
--------------------
Text: European windstorm:  They form as cyclonic windstorms associated with areas of low atmospheric pressure.
Triplets:<European windstorm
2:
--------------------
<Text: European windstorm:  They are most common in the autumn and winter months.>
Triplets:<European windstorm
3:
--------------------
Text: European windstorm:  On average, the month when most windstorms form is January.
Triplets:<European windstorm
5:
--------------------
Text: European windstorm:  Deep low pressure areas are relatively common over the North Atlantic, sometimes starting as nor'easters off the New England coast, and frequently track across the North Atlantic Ocean towards western Europe, past the north coast of Britain and Ireland and into the Norwegian Sea.
Triplets:<European windstorm
6:
--------------------
Text: European windstorm:  However, when they track further south they can affect almost any country in Europe.
Triplets:<European windstorm
7:
--------------------
Text: European windstorm:  Commonly affected countries include the United Kingdom, Ireland, the Netherlands, Norway, the Faroe Islands and Iceland, but any country in Central Europe, Northern Europe and especially Western Europe is occasionally struck by such a storm system.

Triplets:<Europe
